image_1.description: A young girl dressed in a dress, wearing a crown and holding a scepter, who is the protagonist interacting with the Queens and navigating the challenges in the Looking-Glass world.
An older man with a large nose, wearing a crown and a robe, sitting on the ground, who is not explicitly mentioned in the text but can be inferred as part of the royal setting.
A woman with a large nose, wearing a crown and a robe, sitting on the ground, representing the White Queen and the Red Queen who are central to the narrative in the Looking-Glass world.
A staff held by Alice, symbolizing authority or power, which is also referenced in the text as part of Alice's royal attire.
A royal headpiece worn by Alice, King, and Queen, symbolizing royalty, which is also mentioned in the text as part of the attire of the characters.
The image feature block image_1_clock-2.jpg is a picture of a clock, which is not explicitly mentioned in the text but could be related to the time-based events in the story.
An arched doorway that Alice encounters, symbolizing a transition or a new role for her, which is also mentioned in the text with the words 'QUEEN ALICE' in large letters.
One of the bell-handles at the doorway, indicating a choice for Alice regarding her status, which is also mentioned in the text as 'Visitors' Bell'.
The other bell-handle at the doorway, further complicating Alice's decision on her status, which is also mentioned in the text as 'Servants' Bell'.
A character Alice encounters who is dressed in yellow and has a conversation with her about the door, which is also mentioned in the text as a creature with a long beak.

image_2.description: A young girl dressed in a dress with a crown on her head, holding a scepter and standing in front of a door. Alice is the protagonist who interacts with the Queens, showing obedience and later confusion and impatience.
An ornate wooden door with the inscription 'Queen Alice' above it. The Door is a significant geographical entity in the text, representing a barrier and a point of interaction for Alice.

A creature resembling a bird with human-like features, wearing a coat and hat, holding a stick and bowing to Alice. This character is not mentioned in the text, so it remains as described in the image entity.

The Red Queen is a character who suggests soothing actions for the White Queen and later joins her in sleep, indicating a caring side. She is also one of the queens at the head of the table, giving orders and interacting with Alice.

The White Queen is a character who is tired and sleeps on Alice's shoulder, showing a sense of vulnerability. She is also the other queen at the head of the table, offering to repeat a riddle about fishes to Alice.

image_3.description: A large, egg-shaped character with a human face and limbs, wearing a long coat and standing on a wall, as depicted in the Looking-Glass World.
A curved surface in the Looking-Glass World on which Humpty Dumpty is standing, serving as a significant geographical entity in the narrative.

The Red Queen is a character who suggests soothing actions for the White Queen, later joins her in sleep, indicating a caring side, and is one of the queens at the head of the table, giving orders and interacting with Alice.

The White Queen is a character who is tired and sleeps on Alice's shoulder, showing a sense of vulnerability, and is the other queen at the head of the table, offering to repeat a riddle about fishes to Alice.

Alice is the protagonist who interacts with the Queens, showing obedience and later confusion and impatience, and is the main character in the story, experiencing a surreal and chaotic event involving the Red and White Queens.

QUEEN ALICE is an arched doorway that Alice encounters in the Looking-Glass World, symbolizing a transition or a new role for her, and is also a title used by the Red Queen when toasting to Alice's health, indicating a possible confusion or play on words with Alice's name.

image_4.description: Alice is the main character in the story, interacting with various creatures and queens in a fantastical setting, including the Red Queen and the White Queen, and experiencing surreal events such as a dinner party where objects come to life.
The King is a character in the fantastical setting of the Looking-Glass World, wearing a crown and a robe, and is associated with the Queen, possibly the Red King or a similar authority figure.

The Queen is a character in the fantastical setting of the Looking-Glass World, wearing a crown and a robe, and is associated with the King. She could be the Red Queen or the White Queen, both of whom interact with Alice during the dinner event.
The Flamingo is an object used as a croquet mallet in a surreal game within the fantastical setting of the Looking-Glass World, as part of the croquet set that includes hoops and mallets.
The Hedgehog is an object used as a ball in a surreal game within the fantastical setting of the Looking-Glass World, as part of the croquet set that includes hoops and mallets.
The Croquet Set is a set of equipment used in a surreal game within the Looking-Glass World, including a flamingo as a mallet and a hedgehog as a ball, as described in the text and image entities.
The Table Setting is an object mentioned in the image entities, which could be related to the central table where the feast takes place in the Looking-Glass World, as described in the text entities.

The Red Queen is one of the queens at the head of the table in the fantastical setting of the Looking-Glass World, giving orders, interacting with Alice, and eventually turning into a kitten. She is a central figure in the dinner event and Alice's dream.

The White Queen is the other queen at the head of the table in the fantastical setting of the Looking-Glass World, offering to repeat a riddle about fishes to Alice and eventually disappearing into a soup tureen. She is a central figure in the dinner event and Alice's dream.

image_5.description: A cartoon character identified as the 'Red Queen' in the text, wearing a crown and a robe, appearing to be in motion with one arm extended forward and the other bent at the elbow.

image_6.description: Alice is the main character in the story, interacting with various creatures and queens in a fantastical setting, and experiencing a surreal and chaotic event involving the Red and White Queens.
The Red Queen is one of the queens at the head of the table, giving orders and interacting with Alice, and is also a character in Alice's dream, whom Alice suspects the kitten turned into.

image_7.description: Alice is the main character in the story, experiencing a surreal and chaotic event involving the Red and White Queens, and is also depicted as a young girl with long hair, dressed in a dress, holding a flamingo and a hedgehog.

The Red Queen is a character who interacts with Alice, pushing her and causing mischief, eventually turning into a kitten, and is also mentioned as a character in Alice's dream whom Alice suspects the kitten turned into.

The White Kitten is another character in the story, whom Alice refers to as the 'White Queen' in her dream, and is also mentioned as a character Alice interacts with, warning her about something happening and eventually disappearing into a soup tureen.
The Cat is a character in the story, sitting on the ground and observing Alice, and is also mentioned as a character Alice wonders if Dinah turned into during her dream.
